value.0: <StartAction>[You enter the makeshift throneroom, the stench of rot and decay hanging heavily in the air. Sitting nonchantly before you is an Elven man, his thin face twisted in a cruel sneer. His guards shift uncomfortably as he beckons you closer.]</Start>

Well, well, well, I trust you woke pleasantly... Allow me to welcome you to my little lair beneath the city of Ghaarak. Business is slow but profitable and we so seldom receive visitors in this place...
<StartAction>[Markius steps forward and places his hand upon your shoulder.]</Start> Wait, <FirstName>, not yet. First, I have business I must attend to with this man. Isn't that right... Jhordak?
<StartAction>[The Elf's eyes take on a dangerous gleam.]</Start> Now, now, <lad/lass>... you should not speak to your host in such a deprecating tone. I am not a man to be trifled with...

<StartAction>[He seems to calm a bit, but still gazes at you darkly.]</Start> Now, before I conduct business, I usually like to get to know who I am dealing with. Please allow me to introduce myself. My name is...
<StartAction>[Markius suddenly comes forward, his eyes burning with intensity.]</Start> I believe I can help with that... This accursed piece of filth is called Jhordak...

<StartAction>[The Elven leader of the Bloodhawks claps his hands in delight.]</Start> It is good to see you again, my old friend Mister Albright. I knew the day would come when our paths would cross once more...
Oh, I'm sure you thought you were terribly clever in  tracking me down to this lair, but I assure you I was quite aware of all your inquiries into my whereabouts, old friend...
You should have stayed in hiding, Markius. There are few who escape my grasp, and those who do would be well advised to stay out of it once and for all. But not you... No, you keep coming back...
You simply had to follow me, had to involve yourself in my affairs, didn't you... That is a mistake I shall make you sorely regret... Yes, very sorely indeed.
So be it, little <man/woman>...
<StartAction>[Markius's face has turned red with anger, and he gives Jhordak a scathing glare. He does not reply to your question, simply clenching his fists ever tighter.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Jhordak gives a hearty chuckle.]</Start> I see Markius still harbors some resentment against me, but let it not be said that Jhordak or the Bloodhawks are ingracious hosts...

To answer your question, Markius and I know each other quite well... He was the only slave to ever escape my clutches and now I can finally punish him for all of the humiliation I have suffered on his behalf...
<StartAction>[Markius clenches his fists, his jaw set in grim determination.]</Start> You are mistaken, Jhordak... The humiliation has just begun.
<StartAction>[A cruel sneer emerges on Jhordak's face.]</Start> I tire of this witless banter! You and your companion shall die this <quarterday>, slave, mark my words!
I'm afraid the time for talking is over, <lad/lass>...
<StartAction>[Jhordak motions to his men.]</Start> Come! Let us show these precocious upstarts what comes of crossing blades with the Bloodhawks!

<StartAction>[Jhordak gives you an amused grin.]</Start> What can I say? We Bloodhawks did not build our reputation on any code of honor... Besides, I dare not risk you informing the authorities of our cozy little location.
And now your companion has brought you right to me! <He/She> has sold you up the river, as it were. How does it feel to be betrayed, once again, into my hands?
<StartAction>[Markius' eyes grow large.]</Start> <FirstName>, is it true? How could you do such a thing?! Have you any idea what you've done?!

<StartAction>[The Bloodhawk leader, Jhordak, cackles in amusement.]</Start> Don't be so hard on your companion, Markius. I would have caught you eventually. <FirstName>, here, has simply saved me the trouble...
I've come to put an end to this slave trade once and for all!
To business, then. The sooner I leave this cesspit, the better...
My pleasure but it would be more pleasant if I knew your name.
I care little for this nonsense! Let us be done with this!
What in the name of the gods is he talking about, Markius?
I take it you two know each other?
Can't we talk this over?
So be it, Bloodhawks... Let's get this battle started!
But we had a deal! I brought you Markius, and I want my reward!
